content: Hello @T-compiler/meeting! We have a planning meeting today. Leave a :wave: to show you're here :smile:
It appears we have no meeting proposals at this time.
We do have several open MCPs so I think we'll take this block of time to discuss some of those.
Sorting oldest-to-newest: https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Amajor-change+sort%3Acreated-asc
• rustdoc is using rustc_ast_pretty, would it be possible to make it somewhat "stable"? #403
As I recall, we've discussed this in past meetings as well.
did we come to any conclusion?
/me looking
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-08-27/near/250942036
I believe that is the most recent discussion
I think the situation here is unchanged and we still need to build consensus on the correct technical approach.
I don't think we have the right stakeholders in this meeting currently so I'll move on.
Is this about the same MCP?
the zulip link takes me to something about the tcx
Hmm ... oh, no you are correct.
oh, the link takes me to end of the discussion
The conversation starts here https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-08-27/near/250938726
Ok, so this is basically waiting on the MCP text to be tweaked.

and for now, we’ll close this MCP

says Felix at the end :)
I think the discussion restarted again after that point.
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-08-27/near/250941016
Around here https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-08-27/near/250940412
It sounds like we want the proposal to be more specific about what is being promised.
Ah, I see "and for now we'll close this MCP".
/me needs more coffee before trying to read these threads.
Let's go ahead and close this as we decided in that meeting.
• Write text output files to stdout if options like -o - or --emit asm=- are provided #431
Looks like this is just waiting for FCP to complete.
Ticked my box.

Since varkor has stepped back from compiler work for the time being, I'm tempted to tick their box as well but I'd like to give @nikomatsakis and @Esteban Küber a chance to weigh in before this goes to FCP.
Ok, next.
• CI should exercise (subset of) tests under --stage 1 #439
Discussed here https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-08-27/near/250942125
Seems like this is waiting for @pnkfelix to make changes to the proposal.

Looks like there is ongoing discussion in https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/233931-t-compiler.2Fmajor-changes/topic/CI.20should.20exercise.20.28subset.20of.29.20tests.20unde.E2.80.A6.20compiler-team.23439 as well.
I think we can leave this as-is.
Next.
• Accept pc in place of unknown and unknown in place of pc for x86_64 and i?86 targets #441
I know we've discussed this in the past.

Wesley Wiser said:

Since varkor has stepped back from compiler work for the time being, I'm tempted to tick their box as well but I'd like to give nikomatsakis and Esteban Küber a chance to weigh in before this goes to FCP.

checked
Edit: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-09-24/near/254717892
Thanks @nikomatsakis!
Seems like we did not arrive at a conclusion then.

There was additional discussion in the MCP stream after this point https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/233931-t-compiler.2Fmajor-changes/topic/Accept.20.60pc.60.20in.20place.20of.20.60unknown.60.20and.20.60un.E2.80.A6.20compiler-team.23441/near/254719030
It reads to me like there are still multiple unresolved questions around what the correct behavior of various tools & features should be in the presence of alias.
I will leave a message and see if any progress has been made on those questions.
Next.
• Tier 3 target proposal: x86_64-unknown-none (freestanding/bare-metal x86-64) #462
I seconded this last week so it's nearing the end of it's final comment period.
Moving on.
• Make -Z binary-dep-depinfo the default behavior #464
This is a relatively new MCP so I don't believe we've discussed it before.

This feedback from ehuss seems very relevant https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/233931-t-compiler.2Fmajor-changes/topic/Make.20.60-Z.20binary-dep-depinfo.60.20the.20default.20.E2.80.A6.20compiler-team.23464/near/254751340
Hmm are there additional issues besides the one listed?
Oh, I guess there are two

• Canonicalized paths on Windows
  • Codegen backends not tracked

I think if we have a plan to resolve the codegen backend issue, that would be ok and we wouldn't necessarily require it to be implemented before stabilization (since codegen backends are unstable currently)
The Windows path issue does seem like it needs to be resolved though.
Given that it's a tier 1 platform and we don't want to stabilize this feature and then have to potentially change it in some way to fully resolve that issue.
I will leave a comment in that stream as well with my opinion.
And that's the MCP list.
Thanks for attending @T-compiler/meeting! Have a great rest of your week :wave:
Thanks for running the meeting, @Wesley Wiser !
